match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: England won by 7 wickets (with 180 balls remaining)

image.caption: A general view of the County Ground
image.longCaption: A general view of the County Ground, England v Australia, June 10, 2001

match.hoursInfo: 11.00 start, First Session 11.00-14.30 Interval 14.30-15.15, Second Session 15.15-18.45

headshotImage.longCaption: Jake Ball player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sam Billings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sam Billings player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andy Balbirnie c †Billings b Ball 30 (38b 4x4 0x6 41m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! A flat-foot waft as Ball found some lift outside off, and Billings grabs well, moving to his right. The end of what became a combative knock from Balbirnie

headshotImage.caption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ed Joyce lbw b Willey 23 (20b 3x4 0x6 31m) SR: 115

dismissalComment.html: much fuller, strikes the pad and up goes the finger! Joyce might felt that was sliding down leg, but if so, he should have got bat on it and sent it on its way. Batsman error, and England have both openers!

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: slides this one on, Wilson plays with an angled bat, the ball thuds into the front pad... and Dar gives it! Wilson quickly reviews, however, seemingly confident he got some bat on it... but no, it passed under the edge, missed the glove and he was pinned right in front! England have another and Ireland are in a spot of bother now. Rashid liked the look of it from the start, scrambled the seam so minimal turn and Hawk-Eye had it hitting the top of middle and leg

tosses up the googly, spins back in to hit the front pad, the ball loops to slip... and up goes Aleem Dar's finger again! <del>Think this has clipped the inside edge and been given as a catch, though</del> Rashid was initially appealing for lbw and KOB didn't bother asking for a second opinion, Hawk-Eye eventually showing it to be smashing leg stump; either way, Ireland are six down and England are all over them like a knock-off kit
bowled him, another one goes! Two in the over for Rashid and Thompson's three-ball stay is over, completely deceived playing back to a slider, or googly, that thuds resoundingly into off stump

gives it some air, O'Brien heaves to leg, misses the ball - and whaddayaknow, that's out! NOB rolls his eyes as Dar pulls the trigger again, think more in disappointment at the shot than the decision. Simple legbreak, pitching on leg and straightening to hit the back leg

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: humpty again, but he picks out long-on - Rashid has his five-for and Ireland have been dumptied for 128! Tossed up the googly and Murtagh obliged by picking out the safe hands of Alex Hales, Ireland dismissed for a calamitously low score, looking green in more than one sense

gives it some air, Porterfield tries to get on with it... and chips  to mid-off! A gift of a wicket and Ireland's captain trudges off, having done neither one thing nor the other with that stodgy innings

raps the pads, Root appeals... and up goes the finger! Ireland are swaying the breeze, looking anything but shipshape and Bristol fashion as Root wins another lbw decision, this time from Rob Bailey. He fired it into the pitch, skidding on without turn and homing in on leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Paul Stirling b Wood 20 (18b 5x4 0x6 25m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: through the gate! Through the canyon, if truth be told, as Stirling gave himself acres of space outside the leg stump, but Wood's angle from wide on the crease, and nip off the surface, pinged his delivery with a pleasing 'clunk' into the top of middle stump

headshotImage.caption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gives it some air, Porterfield tries to get on with it... and chips  to mid-off! A gift of a wicket and Ireland's captain trudges off, having done neither one thing nor the other with that stodgy innings

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Wilson lbw b Rashid 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slides this one on, Wilson plays with an angled bat, the ball thuds into the front pad... and Dar gives it! Wilson quickly reviews, however, seemingly confident he got some bat on it... but no, it passed under the edge, missed the glove and he was pinned right in front! England have another and Ireland are in a spot of bother now. Rashid liked the look of it from the start, scrambled the seam so minimal turn and Hawk-Eye had it hitting the top of middle and leg

headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kevin O'Brien lbw b Rashid 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: tosses up the googly, spins back in to hit the front pad, the ball loops to slip... and up goes Aleem Dar's finger again! <del>Think this has clipped the inside edge and been given as a catch, though</del> Rashid was initially appealing for lbw and KOB didn't bother asking for a second opinion, Hawk-Eye eventually showing it to be smashing leg stump; either way, Ireland are six down and England are all over them like a knock-off kit

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Thompson b Rashid 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, another one goes! Two in the over for Rashid and Thompson's three-ball stay is over, completely deceived playing back to a slider, or googly, that thuds resoundingly into off stump

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell lbw b Root 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: raps the pads, Root appeals... and up goes the finger! Ireland are swaying the breeze, looking anything but shipshape and Bristol fashion as Root wins another lbw decision, this time from Rob Bailey. He fired it into the pitch, skidding on without turn and homing in on leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Niall O'Brien lbw b Rashid 16 (41b 0x4 0x6 53m) SR: 39.02

dismissalComment.html: gives it some air, O'Brien heaves to leg, misses the ball - and whaddayaknow, that's out! NOB rolls his eyes as Dar pulls the trigger again, think more in disappointment at the shot than the decision. Simple legbreak, pitching on leg and straightening to hit the back leg

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Murtagh c Hales b Rashid 11 (16b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: humpty again, but he picks out long-on - Rashid has his five-for and Ireland have been dumptied for 128! Tossed up the googly and Murtagh obliged by picking out the safe hands of Alex Hales, Ireland dismissed for a calamitously low score, looking green in more than one sense

dismissalText.commentary: Alex Hales c Porterfield b Chase 55 (39b 10x4 0x6 47m) SR: 141.02

dismissalComment.html: short ball, swings hard again, there's a big top edge on this, swirling towards backward point - well taken by Porterfield! Hales' luck runs out, but not before he'd taken advantage with a rapid fifty. Another wicket for Chase but Ireland need a few more to make the home fans nervous

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root not out 49 (52b 7x4 0x6 78m) SR: 94.23

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: shuffles forward, whipped off the pads... but taken low at midwicket by Dockrell! Ireland have their breakthrough, an impetuous shot from Roy, not keeping the ball down and sharply taken. In the words of Jeremy Corbyn: The fightback starts here!

short ball, swings hard again, there's a big top edge on this, swirling towards backward point - well taken by Porterfield! Hales' luck runs out, but not before he'd taken advantage with a rapid fifty. Another wicket for Chase but Ireland need a few more to make the home fans nervous

short ball, Morgan swings it to leg, high in the air... and Kevin O'Brien makes his ground from fine leg to take an excellent running catch! England are three down, another for Chase... and Jonny Bairstow will get a bat after all!

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: shuffles forward, whipped off the pads... but taken low at midwicket by Dockrell! Ireland have their breakthrough, an impetuous shot from Roy, not keeping the ball down and sharply taken. In the words of Jeremy Corbyn: The fightback starts here!

Hales' luck runs out, but not before he'd taken advantage with a rapid fifty. Another wicket for Chase but Ireland need a few more to make the home fans nervous

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan c KJ O'Brien b Chase 10 (12b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: short ball, Morgan swings it to leg, high in the air... and Kevin O'Brien makes his ground from fine leg to take an excellent running catch! England are three down, another for Chase... and Jonny Bairstow will get a bat after all!

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: pitched up and driven wide of mid-on - that's it, England win by seven wickets and there's not even time for an interval

commentPostTextItems.html: 3.05pm: It's been short and sweet, from an English perspective; a sour lolly to suck on for Ireland. But take heart, because there's Lord's on Sunday and the chance for redemption in one of the cathedrals of sport... Join us again for the second ODI, and enjoy your Friday afternoon. International cricket is back - we'll be here all summer. Cheerio!

2.55pm: Here we go with the presentations... Ireland captain William Porterfield: "The first five or six overs with the bat we looked like we could put a score on the board but we were in trouble once we lost Stirlo and Joyce. We knew there would be a bit of nibble [batting first] but we thought we could build a platform for the lads at the end. When it comes to this stage, games come thick and fast, it's more of a mental thing, to put yourself back on track. We've had a lot of support here today and they'll be there at Lord's, so we've got to out in a performance for them."

England captain Eoin Morgan: "Very pleased, pretty convincing, we bowled one or two bad balls in the first ten overs but it was a good wicket, probably the best Bristol wicket we've played on, so losing the toss wasn't a bad thing. Adil today, it shows the threat legspin poses, turning it both ways, he's very threatening. [Mark Wood?] First game back it's important to get overs under your belt, manage the expectation, important he builds up momentum to the CT. [Rashid?] He's had a tough winter playing against high-calibre opposition, so to come back and show calmness and composure was great. I think we have a stiffer test with the SA series coming up, it's part and parcel of our preparation. Take nothing away from Ireland, they have the ability to beat any side, so we need to start again at Lord's. I think on any given day we probably do [know best XI], given one or two changes for conditions, that's important going into a competition."

Adil Rashid is Man of the Match for his career-best ODI figures: "I feel quite confident at the moment, feel pretty good. It's come from hard work in the nets and practice, knowing my fields, knowing how you feel on a good day and when you don't feel so good. [Favourite ball?] Sometimes it's the googly, sometimes the leggie, I just try and bowl my variations and feel comfortable with that."

2.45pm: That's what you call doing a professional number on the oppo. England wouldn't get much credit for anything other than a thumping - and that's what they have served up, Ireland dismissed for a paltry score in 33 overs and the chase mopped up before lunch. The whole match lasted just a wee bit beyond 50 overs, and Ireland have some work to do if they are going to save face in the second match of the series at Lord's on Sunday. We knew the Old Boys in Green were facing a transition period but they would have hoped to provide a stiffer challenge in their first match on English soil than this.

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full in the channel, YJB pushes at it and gets an inside edge on to his front pad... Root stops him from doing something silly as Porterfield races in from backward point
fired in full down the leg side, 83mph and thudding into the pads as Bairstow aims a glance unsuccessfully
short ball, Root swivels to swipe another single through square leg
there's a dot, back of a length and defended on off stump
length on the stumps and swished through midwicket on the pull
oh, lovely shot, a back-foot square drive, on top of the bounce and that's the third boundary of the over, bringing England to within touching distance of victory

commentPostTextItems.html: "Lunch with 6 to win someone said...I'm going with scores level after YJB gets out trying to end it in the grand manner," declares Andy

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: back of a length, clubbed out towards deep midwicket, off the toe of the bat for a single
chopped square from the crease... but Thompson had overstepped, so that'll be a free hit
full outside off, YJB steps into a princely straight drive, fine of mid-off and that's four more - target being reeled in, single figures now
more runs, overpitched and threaded through the covers, holds up just short of the rope
slides on to the pads and Root just needs a tickle of bat on it to pick up four to fine leg

commentPreTextItems.html: Stuart Thompson back on. England have three overs to score 21 runs and avoid putting everyone into 45 minutes of limbo... Or Ireland could take seven wickets, I suppose

commentTextItems.html: tip and run into the covers, beats the throw at the non-striker's end
bouncer from Chase, doesn't get up that high and it's swatted to deep square leg for one more

commentPostTextItems.html: "TV saying they're extending by four overs in case of a result. Presumably it's also to make sure they get the minimum of 20 overs in, in case somehow the weather forecasters get it horribly wrong." I don't think it's anywhere near that joined up, Joel... But we'll give them the benefit of the doubt

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and tapped down short into the off side
short outside off, Root is up on his toes to cut down and in front of point

edged but short of slip and it runs away for four! Decent bowling from Chase, in the corridor and Root was a little flat-footed but he played softly and it scuttled away low through the hands for four
short delivery, Bairstow pulls firmly and picks up his first run to deep midwicket - that's the England 100, too

commentPreTextItems.html: On we go, England have four overs to try and wrap this up

commentTextItems.html: length ball on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
pitched up and clipped into the leg side, midwicket cuts it off - that's a maiden, with England stuck on 99

commentPostTextItems.html: "Billy Root outdoing this brother. On 82 with 8 balls of the innings remaining and finished on 107*." There's more than one Root to victory in this game, Stefan...

dismissalComment.html: humpty again, but he picks out long-on - Rashid has his five-for and Ireland have been dumptied for 128! Tossed up the googly and Murtagh obliged by picking out the safe hands of Alex Hales, Ireland dismissed for a calamitously low score, looking green in more than one sense

gives it some air, Porterfield tries to get on with it... and chips  to mid-off! A gift of a wicket and Ireland's captain trudges off, having done neither one thing nor the other with that stodgy innings

raps the pads, Root appeals... and up goes the finger! Ireland are swaying the breeze, looking anything but shipshape and Bristol fashion as Root wins another lbw decision, this time from Rob Bailey. He fired it into the pitch, skidding on without turn and homing in on leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Paul Stirling b Wood 20 (18b 5x4 0x6 25m) SR: 111.11

dismissalComment.html: through the gate! Through the canyon, if truth be told, as Stirling gave himself acres of space outside the leg stump, but Wood's angle from wide on the crease, and nip off the surface, pinged his delivery with a pleasing 'clunk' into the top of middle stump

headshotImage.caption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: David Willey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ed Joyce lbw b Willey 23 (20b 3x4 0x6 31m) SR: 115

dismissalComment.html: much fuller, strikes the pad and up goes the finger! Joyce might felt that was sliding down leg, but if so, he should have got bat on it and sent it on its way. Batsman error, and England have both openers!

headshotImage.caption: Jake Ball player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jake Ball player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sam Billings player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sam Billings player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Andy Balbirnie c †Billings b Ball 30 (38b 4x4 0x6 41m) SR: 78.94

dismissalComment.html: edged and gone! A flat-foot waft as Ball found some lift outside off, and Billings grabs well, moving to his right. The end of what became a combative knock from Balbirnie

headshotImage.caption: Liam Plunkett player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liam Plunkett player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: William Porterfield c Plunkett b Root 13 (45b 0x4 0x6 64m) SR: 28.88

dismissalComment.html: gives it some air, Porterfield tries to get on with it... and chips  to mid-off! A gift of a wicket and Ireland's captain trudges off, having done neither one thing nor the other with that stodgy innings

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Wilson lbw b Rashid 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slides this one on, Wilson plays with an angled bat, the ball thuds into the front pad... and Dar gives it! Wilson quickly reviews, however, seemingly confident he got some bat on it... but no, it passed under the edge, missed the glove and he was pinned right in front! England have another and Ireland are in a spot of bother now. Rashid liked the look of it from the start, scrambled the seam so minimal turn and Hawk-Eye had it hitting the top of middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kevin O'Brien lbw b Rashid 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: tosses up the googly, spins back in to hit the front pad, the ball loops to slip... and up goes Aleem Dar's finger again! <del>Think this has clipped the inside edge and been given as a catch, though</del> Rashid was initially appealing for lbw and KOB didn't bother asking for a second opinion, Hawk-Eye eventually showing it to be smashing leg stump; either way, Ireland are six down and England are all over them like a knock-off kit

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Thompson b Rashid 4 (3b 1x4 0x6 3m) SR: 133.33

dismissalComment.html: bowled him, another one goes! Two in the over for Rashid and Thompson's three-ball stay is over, completely deceived playing back to a slider, or googly, that thuds resoundingly into off stump

dismissalText.commentary: George Dockrell lbw b Root 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: raps the pads, Root appeals... and up goes the finger! Ireland are swaying the breeze, looking anything but shipshape and Bristol fashion as Root wins another lbw decision, this time from Rob Bailey. He fired it into the pitch, skidding on without turn and homing in on leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Niall O'Brien lbw b Rashid 16 (41b 0x4 0x6 53m) SR: 39.02

dismissalComment.html: gives it some air, O'Brien heaves to leg, misses the ball - and whaddayaknow, that's out! NOB rolls his eyes as Dar pulls the trigger again, think more in disappointment at the shot than the decision. Simple legbreak, pitching on leg and straightening to hit the back leg

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Tim Murtagh player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Murtagh c Hales b Rashid 11 (16b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 68.75

dismissalComment.html: humpty again, but he picks out long-on - Rashid has his five-for and Ireland have been dumptied for 128! Tossed up the googly and Murtagh obliged by picking out the safe hands of Alex Hales, Ireland dismissed for a calamitously low score, looking green in more than one sense

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Roy c Dockrell b Chase 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: shuffles forward, whipped off the pads... but taken low at midwicket by Dockrell! Ireland have their breakthrough, an impetuous shot from Roy, not keeping the ball down and sharply taken. In the words of Jeremy Corbyn: The fightback starts here!

dismissalText.commentary: Alex Hales c Porterfield b Chase 55 (39b 10x4 0x6 47m) SR: 141.02

dismissalComment.html: short ball, swings hard again, there's a big top edge on this, swirling towards backward point - well taken by Porterfield! Hales' luck runs out, but not before he'd taken advantage with a rapid fifty. Another wicket for Chase but Ireland need a few more to make the home fans nervous

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root not out 49 (52b 7x4 0x6 78m) SR: 94.23
Eoin Morgan c KJ O'Brien b Chase 10 (12b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: short ball, Morgan swings it to leg, high in the air... and Kevin O'Brien makes his ground from fine leg to take an excellent running catch! England are three down, another for Chase... and Jonny Bairstow will get a bat after all!

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jonny Bairstow not out 10 (15b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 66.66

notes: Ireland: 50 runs in 9.2 overs (56 balls), Extras 1
Over 22.5: Review by Ireland (Batting), Umpire - Aleem Dar, Batsman - GC Wilson (Struck down)
Ireland: 100 runs in 25.2 overs (152 balls), Extras 2
Innings Break: Ireland - 126/10 in 33.0 overs (PKD Chase 1)
England: 50 runs in 6.4 overs (42 balls), Extras 2
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 37 balls (AD Hales 36, JE Root 13, Ex 1)
England: 100 runs in 17.2 overs (106 balls), Extras 2

milestones.description: This is the lowest match aggregate (253) involving teams England & Ireland in ODIs
Porterfield has scored 22 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for IRE breaking Paul Stirling's record

stories.title: Porterfield calls on Ireland to 'get fired up' for Lord's
stories.subTitle: England v Ireland, 1st ODI, Bristol

stories.summary: William Porterfield said his side need to "park the game and leave it in Bristol" after they were heavily beaten in the first ODI against England

stories.title: Rashid takes five as Ireland are routed in historic ODI
stories.subTitle: England v Ireland, 1st ODI, Bristol
stories.seoTitle: Adil Rashid takes five as Ireland are routed in historic ODI
stories.summary: Adil Rashid bagged a career-best 5 for 27, and Alex Hales made 55 from 39 balls, as England won by seven wickets with 30 overs to spare
